search.slidetext: earth and space high school high school science grade 10
compare the ways tectonic plates move in relation to each other convergent divergent transform plate movements and boundaries

plate movements and boundaries according to the theory of plate tectonics, the earth’s crust consists of several large interlocking plates that move in different directions and velocities. theory of plate tectonics it states that the earth’s crust consists of several large interlocking plates that move around by floating on top of the mantle. crust these plates move around by floating on top of the mantle. mantle over millions of years, these plates have carved and created the shapes of our continents and oceans, crafting the great mountain ranges and oceanic ridges. convection currect this theory revolutionized our understanding of how earth functions on a global scale. plates move in several ways. a single plate may exhibit different movements and boundary types in certain areas of its edges. there are three major types of plate movements and associated boundaries: divergent plate boundaries, convergent plate boundaries, and transform plate boundaries. divergent convergent transform

plate movements and boundaries in divergent plate boundaries, new crust is generated as the plates pull away from each other. divergent plate boundaries a divergent boundary is a fault where the two plates are moving away from each other. there are several processes involving divergent plate boundaries. the first process is called rifting. divergent plate boundaries a divergent boundary is a fault where the two plates are moving away from each other. rifting it occurs when the moving currents beneath a plate interior causes an existing plate to move apart and be separated into two or smaller plates. rifting occurs when the moving currents beneath a plate interior causes an existing plate to move apart and be separated into two or smaller plates. convection currect an example of this is the great rift valley in east africa, where the african plate is in the initial stages of coming apart.

a divergent boundary is a fault where the two plates are moving away from each other. divergent plate boundaries once rifting continues, divergence occurs. divergence convection currect in a few million years or so, the oceans will occupy the depression, forming two separate boundaries. in a few million years or so, the oceans will occupy the depression, forming two separate boundaries. an example of this is the red sea that separates the arabian peninsula from mainland africa. red sea

convection currect a divergent boundary is a fault where the two plates are moving away from each other. sea-floor spreading divergent plate boundaries the third process is called the sea-floor spreading. in sea-floor spreading, molten material rises, forming a new edge as the older segments separate further, forming oceans and other similar bodies of water. in sea-floor spreading, molten material rises, forming a new edge as the older segments separate further, forming oceans and other similar bodies of water. it is also in this process where mid-ocean ridges are present. sea-floor spreading is the interface between divergent plates and is often the center of volcanic activity.

plate movements and boundaries in convergent plate boundaries, crust is destroyed as one plate dives under another. a convergent boundary is a boundary where two separate plates are pushing into each other. convergent plate boundaries a convergent boundary is a boundary where two separate plates are pushing into each other. convergent plate boundaries convergent plate boundaries involve two continental plates, two oceanic plates, or one of each. continental plate + continental plate oceanic plate + oceanic plate continental plate + oceanic plate several processes may occur during the convergence of the two plates. the first one is called subduction. subduction it occurs in plate boundaries that have at least one oceanic plate. in subduction, the denser plates dive underneath the lighter, less dense plate. in this process, the denser plates dive underneath the lighter, less dense plates, causing the denser plates to be melted in the mantle. when sections of the denser plate reach the mantle, they melt. oceanic lithosphere is always denser than the continental lithosphere, and thus it always dives down, whereas the continental lithosphere is generally more buoyant.

convergent plate boundaries a convergent boundary is a boundary where two separate plates are pushing into each other. continental collisions the stresses due to by convergence generate earthquakes and the newly melted subducted plate causes the growth of volcanic chains. oceanic crust lithosphere volcanic arc continental crust magma upper mantle initially these volcanoes were underwater, but after millions of years, they emerged to form a chain of volcanic islands called an island arc. the subduction of an oceanic trench on a continental one generates the world’s most powerful earthquakes and leads to the formation of volcanoes. it is also possible for two oceanic plates to converge, and due to similar densities both dive into the mantle forming oceanic trenches.

convergent plate boundaries a convergent boundary is a boundary where two separate plates are pushing into each other. another process, called continental collisions, occurs along the continental plates, where two continental plates may form one single plate. continental collisions it occurs along the continental plates, where two continental plates may form one single plate. this mechanism has built the earth’s great mountain ranges including the andes, himalayas, and the european alps.

plate movements and boundaries aside from a head-on collision between plates, the third kind of boundary is when plates move past each other on opposite directions. this boundary is called a transform fault. at boundaries like this, the plates neither grow nor get consumed. transform faults a transform fault or transform boundary is a plate boundary where the motion is predominantly horizontal. this type of mechanism doesn’t allow for molten material from the mantle to move upward and therefore causes little or no volcanism. in transform boundaries, crust is neither produced nor destroyed as the plates slide horizontally past each other. in transform boundaries, crust is neither produced nor destroyed as the plates slide horizontally past each other. similar to convergent boundaries, this type of boundary causes significant earthquake activity. similar to convergent boundaries, this type of boundary causes significant earthquake activity.

there are three major types of plate movements and associated boundaries: divergent plate boundaries, where plates move away from each other; convergent plate boundaries, where plates move onto each other; and transform plate boundaries, where plates move past one another in opposite directions.
the theory of plate tectonics states that the earth’s crust consists of several large interlocking plates that move around by floating on top of the mantle.
